title: ICBC contributes Ps. 150,000,000 to syndicated loan to AES Argentina Generación S.A. in 2015
description: On July 14, 2015, AES Argentina Generación S.A. — the Argentine subsidiary of US electricity provider AES — signed a Ps. 300,000,000 syndicated loan agreement with Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (Argentina) S.A. and Banco Itau Argentina S.A. The proceeds of the loan were to be used by the borrower for working capital purposes. The loan was repayable in nine consecutive quarterly principal amortization installments, beginning the first one in the month of July 2016. It accrued interest at BADLAR rate plus 575 basis points. The maturity of the last installment was in July 2018. The loan contained usual covenants customary for these types of transactions such as reporting requirements, restrictions on pledges, leverage ratios, corporate reorganization, restriction for the execution of certain payments, among others. As of September 30, 2016, the balance of the loan was Ps. 266,670,000.
staff_comments: 1. Given that AidData does not know how much Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (Argentina) S.A. and Banco Itau Argentina S.A. contributed to the syndicated loan, it assumes equal contributions of Ps. 150,000,000 for the time being.2. BADLAR rate is an average rate published by the Central Bank based on a survey of financial institutions in Argentina regarding the nominal annual interest rate in peso-denominated time deposits of more than Ps. 1.0 million from 30 to 35 days. AidData estimates the interest rate by adding the BADLAR rate (20.7%) when the loan was contracted (July 2015) plus 5.75%.3. The China-Latin America Commercial Loans Tracker, which is produced by the Inter-American Dialogue, does not capture the face value or borrowing terms of this ICBC loan.
combined_text:
# Sector
UNALLOCATED/UNSPECIFIED

# Title
ICBC contributes Ps. 150,000,000 to syndicated loan to AES Argentina Generación S.A. in 2015

# Description
On July 14, 2015, AES Argentina Generación S.A. — the Argentine subsidiary of US electricity provider AES — signed a Ps. 300,000,000 syndicated loan agreement with Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (Argentina) S.A. and Banco Itau Argentina S.A. The proceeds of the loan were to be used by the borrower for working capital purposes. The loan was repayable in nine consecutive quarterly principal amortization installments, beginning the first one in the month of July 2016. It accrued interest at BADLAR rate plus 575 basis points. The maturity of the last installment was in July 2018. The loan contained usual covenants customary for these types of transactions such as reporting requirements, restrictions on pledges, leverage ratios, corporate reorganization, restriction for the execution of certain payments, among others. As of September 30, 2016, the balance of the loan was Ps. 266,670,000.
justification: Loan for working capital purposes without specific environmental or energy transition implications
evidence: Syndicated loan for working capital, no specific project details provided

title: Chinese Government provides USD 15 million for the China-Argentina Radio Telescope (CART) Construction Project
description: On June 22, 2015, one Chinese entity and three Government of Argentina entities signed the quadripartite "Collaboration Agreement for the Construction, Installation and Operation of the China-Argentina Radio Telescope (CART)" in San Juan, Argentina. This agreement was approved by Law No. 1386-B of the Chamber of Deputies of San Juan, on December 17, 2015. The signatories included the National University of San Juan (UNSJ), the Provincial Government of San Juan, Argentina's National Scientific and Technical Research Council (CONICET), and the Chinese Academy of Sciences (CAS) National Astronomical Observatories (NAOC).   At an unknown time, the Chinese Ministry of Science and Technology agreed to provide USD 15 million for purchasing the satellite dish. Moreover, the Government of San Juan provided USD 1.5 million for constructing the base on which the satellite would be installed, and the Chinese Academy of Sciences provided USD 5 million for constructing the radio telescope.   The purpose of this project was to construct a radio telescope and all other necessary facilities located at the Dr. Carlos Ulrico Cesco Height Station in the town of El Leoncito, department of Calingasta, about 250 km from the city of San Juan. The telescope's primary reflector is 40 meters in diameter, making it the largest in South America. This project also included the installation of an antenna, positioning system, receiver, and data processing system. The purpose of CART is to promote the astronomical cooperation and exchanges between the Chinese and Argentinian governments as well as conduct scientific research in the fields of international VLBI, astronomical observation, geodesy, and deep space exploration. CART is the first medium and large astronomical observation equipment placed overseas by China.  According to the June 2015 agreement, the Government of San Juan is responsible for the provision of all services, electricity, water, internet and the access route to the place where the CART will be located. This access road was carried out by Vialidad de la Provincia as well as the excavations where the support base was built. The Government of Argentina and the National University of San Juan are in charge of the construction of the base for the radio telescope. A Chinese manufacturer would send 30 Chinese technicians to help the Argentinians assemble the radio telescope. Other parties involved in this project are the China Ministry of Science and Technology, the Argentina Ministry of Science, Technology and Innovation, and San Juan Provincial Government's Secretariat of Science, Technology and Innovation and Secretariat of Roads.  In 2017, the cornerstone was officially presented in 2017 and the the NAOC reported that progress on the radio telescope had reached 70%. In 2018, work on the access road to the CART was complete. By December 2020, the satellite dish base was 95% complete. CART was expected to be operational by the end of 2021. However, works were on-going in 2022.
staff_comments: Chinese project title: 中阿射电望远镜（CART）or 中阿合作40米射电望远镜 or 中阿合作四十米射电望远镜项目 or 中阿CART项目No sources explicitly state that the China Ministry of Science and Technology provided the USD 15 million. AidData assumes this is the case because CART is one of the ministry's flagship Belt and Road projects. Moreover, no sources explicitly state that this USD 15 million is a grant. AidData assumes this is the case based on the lower value and nature of the project.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER MULTISECTOR

# Title
Chinese Government provides USD 15 million for the China-Argentina Radio Telescope (CART) Construction Project

# Description
On June 22, 2015, one Chinese entity and three Government of Argentina entities signed the quadripartite "Collaboration Agreement for the Construction, Installation and Operation of the China-Argentina Radio Telescope (CART)" in San Juan, Argentina. This agreement was approved by Law No. 1386-B of the Chamber of Deputies of San Juan, on December 17, 2015. The signatories included the National University of San Juan (UNSJ), the Provincial Government of San Juan, Argentina's National Scientific and Technical Research Council (CONICET), and the Chinese Academy of Sciences (CAS) National Astronomical Observatories (NAOC).   At an unknown time, the Chinese Ministry of Science and Technology agreed to provide USD 15 million for purchasing the satellite dish. Moreover, the Government of San Juan provided USD 1.5 million for constructing the base on which the satellite would be installed, and the Chinese Academy of Sciences provided USD 5 million for constructing the radio telescope.   The purpose of this project was to construct a radio telescope and all other necessary facilities located at the Dr. Carlos Ulrico Cesco Height Station in the town of El Leoncito, department of Calingasta, about 250 km from the city of San Juan. The telescope's primary reflector is 40 meters in diameter, making it the largest in South America. This project also included the installation of an antenna, positioning system, receiver, and data processing system. The purpose of CART is to promote the astronomical cooperation and exchanges between the Chinese and Argentinian governments as well as conduct scientific research in the fields of international VLBI, astronomical observation, geodesy, and deep space exploration. CART is the first medium and large astronomical observation equipment placed overseas by China.  According to the June 2015 agreement, the Government of San Juan is responsible for the provision of all services, electricity, water, internet and the access route to the place where the CART will be located. This access road was carried out by Vialidad de la Provincia as well as the excavations where the support base was built. The Government of Argentina and the National University of San Juan are in charge of the construction of the base for the radio telescope. A Chinese manufacturer would send 30 Chinese technicians to help the Argentinians assemble the radio telescope. Other parties involved in this project are the China Ministry of Science and Technology, the Argentina Ministry of Science, Technology and Innovation, and San Juan Provincial Government's Secretariat of Science, Technology and Innovation and Secretariat of Roads.  In 2017, the cornerstone was officially presented in 2017 and the the NAOC reported that progress on the radio telescope had reached 70%. In 2018, work on the access road to the CART was complete. By December 2020, the satellite dish base was 95% complete. CART was expected to be operational by the end of 2021. However, works were on-going in 2022.
justification: Project is focused on scientific research and astronomical observation, with no clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of radio telescope for astronomical research and international cooperation, no energy production or industrial components

title: Chinese Government donates Relocatable Military Hospital to the Argentine Army
description: In 2015, China committed to donating a Relocatable Military Hospital (HMR) to the Argentine Army, which was formally donated and received in 2017. The HMR allows for providing surgical and emergency healthcare support for a 48 hour uninterrupted period, performing 2 surgeries simultaneously, hospitalizing 28 patients, and can be easily transported by land, air, and sea in 13x20 foot containers. It serves as an intermediary between outposts of soldiers and permanent military hospitals, intended to diagnose and care for patients during operational deployments.
staff_comments: 1. The name of the hospital in Spanish is the 'Hospital Militar Reubicable (HMR).'
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Chinese Government donates Relocatable Military Hospital to the Argentine Army

# Description
In 2015, China committed to donating a Relocatable Military Hospital (HMR) to the Argentine Army, which was formally donated and received in 2017. The HMR allows for providing surgical and emergency healthcare support for a 48 hour uninterrupted period, performing 2 surgeries simultaneously, hospitalizing 28 patients, and can be easily transported by land, air, and sea in 13x20 foot containers. It serves as an intermediary between outposts of soldiers and permanent military hospitals, intended to diagnose and care for patients during operational deployments.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare infrastructure donation with no direct energy or environmental implications
evidence: Relocatable Military Hospital for surgical and emergency healthcare support, no energy-related components mentioned

title: Chinese Culture room opened at Hovhannes Tumanyan Secondary School in Armenia
description: On May 16th, 2015, a Chinese Culture room opened at the Lori Region’s Hovhannes Tumanyan Secondary School in the northern Armenian city of Stepanavan.  The Chinese Culture room was established on the initiative of the school director, Seda Tunian, as her students have shown increasing interest and enthusiasm in learning Chinese culture and language. Chinese tea, calligraphy, paintings of Chinese themes and literature, information brochures about China were also exhibited in the Culture room.
staff_comments: Based on the government source written in Chinese, the Chinese Culture room represented the cultural connection between the two countries to which governments from both sides pay lots of attention. It implicitly states that the funding of this project is related to the embassy of China and the Confucius Institute in Armenia. However, it is hard to track the transaction amount because the decoration items in the room were negligible.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Culture room opened at Hovhannes Tumanyan Secondary School in Armenia

# Description
On May 16th, 2015, a Chinese Culture room opened at the Lori Region’s Hovhannes Tumanyan Secondary School in the northern Armenian city of Stepanavan.  The Chinese Culture room was established on the initiative of the school director, Seda Tunian, as her students have shown increasing interest and enthusiasm in learning Chinese culture and language. Chinese tea, calligraphy, paintings of Chinese themes and literature, information brochures about China were also exhibited in the Culture room.
justification: Project focuses on cultural exchange and education without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Establishment of Chinese Culture room, focus on cultural and language education

title: China Eximbank provides RMB 155.4 million government concessional loan for Customs Management, Technology, and Modernization Project
description: On March 25, 2015, China Eximbank and the Government of Armenia signed an RMB 155,440,000 government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [No. GCL NO.5 (2015) TOTAL NO.(544)] for the Customs Management, Technology, and Modernization Project. The loan carries the following terms: a 2% interest rate, a 5-year grace period, a 20-year maturity, a 0.25% commitment fee, and a 0.15% management fee. The loan repayment period was scheduled to begin on September 21, 2020, and end on March 21, 2035. The proceeds from the GCL were to be used by the borrower to finance a commercial contract (number NUC-1-14-1092) worth RMB 155,439,953 between the Government of Armenia’s Ministry of Finance and Nuctech Company Limited («Նուքթեք քամփնի»), which was signed on November 14, 2014, and subsequently modified on June 9, 2016. The purpose of the Customs Management, Technology, and Modernization Project is to acquire portable x-ray scanners that are capable of detecting explosive devices, weapons, and other types of contraband.  Nuctech Company Limited is the contractor responsible for implementation. Project implementation was underway as of November 2017; however, the precise project implementation start date is unknown.
staff_comments: The Armenian project title is  մաքսային զննման տեխնոլոգիաների և սարքավորումների արդիականացման or մաքսային զննման տեխնոլոգիաների ևսարքավորումներիարդիականացման ծրագիր or Հայաստանի մաքսային զննման տեխնոլոգիաների և սարքավորումների արդիականացման ծրագիր or Հայաստանի մաքսային զննման տեխնոլոգիաների և սարքավորումների արդիականացման ծրագիր. The China Eximbank loan that supported this project is not included in the Chinese Overseas Development Finance Dataset published by Boston University’s Global Development Policy Center in December 2020.
combined_text:
# Sector
TRADE POLICIES AND REGULATIONS

# Title
China Eximbank provides RMB 155.4 million government concessional loan for Customs Management, Technology, and Modernization Project

# Description
On March 25, 2015, China Eximbank and the Government of Armenia signed an RMB 155,440,000 government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [No. GCL NO.5 (2015) TOTAL NO.(544)] for the Customs Management, Technology, and Modernization Project. The loan carries the following terms: a 2% interest rate, a 5-year grace period, a 20-year maturity, a 0.25% commitment fee, and a 0.15% management fee. The loan repayment period was scheduled to begin on September 21, 2020, and end on March 21, 2035. The proceeds from the GCL were to be used by the borrower to finance a commercial contract (number NUC-1-14-1092) worth RMB 155,439,953 between the Government of Armenia’s Ministry of Finance and Nuctech Company Limited («Նուքթեք քամփնի»), which was signed on November 14, 2014, and subsequently modified on June 9, 2016. The purpose of the Customs Management, Technology, and Modernization Project is to acquire portable x-ray scanners that are capable of detecting explosive devices, weapons, and other types of contraband.  Nuctech Company Limited is the contractor responsible for implementation. Project implementation was underway as of November 2017; however, the precise project implementation start date is unknown.
justification: Project focuses on customs management and security technology, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Customs management and modernization project, acquisition of x-ray scanners for security purposes

title: China donates 30 million drams worth of laptops to Armenian National Assembly
description: In 2015, China donated 30 million Armenian drams worth of laptops to the Armenian National Assembly. During the same year, USAID also provided the Armenian National Assembly with computer equipment worth 538,000 drams and about 2 million drams worth of office equipment.

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 60 million grant — via ETCA — to support Armenian public television
description: On February 3, 2015, the Armenian Deputy Foreign Minister and the Chinese Ambassador to Armenia signed an exchange of letters for a Public Television Station Project. Then, on June 6, 2016, the Chinese Government and the Government of Armenia signed an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA), which committed RMB 60 million of grant funding for the development of the Armenian public television and the implementation of other television-related programs. The ETCA was signed by Armenian Deputy Foreign Minister Robert Harutyunyan and China’s Deputy Minister of Commerce.   This project involved the provision of television equipment to the Public Television Company of Armenia (also known as 1TV, Armenia 1 and ARMTV). INSTEC Import and Export Co., Ltd. was the contractor responsible for implementation. On April 21, 2015, the Public Television Company of Armenia received an HD mobile television station — equipped with 10 video cameras and an HD satellite broadcasting station — from the Chinese Government. In 2015, it also received a digital satellite news gathering (DSNG) device from the Chinese Government, which enables its viewers to watch its broadcasts via PC, mobile phone, and tablets (with Android and IOS systems). The Public Television Company of Armenia received another batch of television equipment (worth 2.509.8 million drams) on October 13, 2016. According to 1News, the equipment that was received from the Chinese Government ensured smooth coverage of events commemorating the 100th anniversary of the Armenian Genocide.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Chinese Government provides RMB 60 million grant — via ETCA — to support Armenian public television

# Description
On February 3, 2015, the Armenian Deputy Foreign Minister and the Chinese Ambassador to Armenia signed an exchange of letters for a Public Television Station Project. Then, on June 6, 2016, the Chinese Government and the Government of Armenia signed an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA), which committed RMB 60 million of grant funding for the development of the Armenian public television and the implementation of other television-related programs. The ETCA was signed by Armenian Deputy Foreign Minister Robert Harutyunyan and China’s Deputy Minister of Commerce.   This project involved the provision of television equipment to the Public Television Company of Armenia (also known as 1TV, Armenia 1 and ARMTV). INSTEC Import and Export Co., Ltd. was the contractor responsible for implementation. On April 21, 2015, the Public Television Company of Armenia received an HD mobile television station — equipped with 10 video cameras and an HD satellite broadcasting station — from the Chinese Government. In 2015, it also received a digital satellite news gathering (DSNG) device from the Chinese Government, which enables its viewers to watch its broadcasts via PC, mobile phone, and tablets (with Android and IOS systems). The Public Television Company of Armenia received another batch of television equipment (worth 2.509.8 million drams) on October 13, 2016. According to 1News, the equipment that was received from the Chinese Government ensured smooth coverage of events commemorating the 100th anniversary of the Armenian Genocide.
justification: Project focuses on media infrastructure development without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Provision of television equipment, HD mobile television station, digital satellite news gathering device, focus on public broadcasting capabilities

title: Hanban donates education materials to Chinese translation multimedia classroom at the Brusov University
description: On September 30, 2015, Brusov State University of Languages and Social Sciences in Yerevan, Armenia, held an opening ceremony for the Chinese translation multimedia classroom. Hanban donated multimedia teaching equipment and textbooks to the school for the classroom. In addition to the Hanban grant, China stated that the Chinese Embassy in Armenia is willing to provide necessary assistance for the multimedia classroom.  Ambassador to Armenia Tian Erlong, Armenian Deputy Foreign Minister Manassarian, Ms. Gasparyan, President of Brüssov University, Dean of Confucius Institute Central Asia and representatives of teachers and students of the school attended the ceremony.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Hanban donates education materials to Chinese translation multimedia classroom at the Brusov University

# Description
On September 30, 2015, Brusov State University of Languages and Social Sciences in Yerevan, Armenia, held an opening ceremony for the Chinese translation multimedia classroom. Hanban donated multimedia teaching equipment and textbooks to the school for the classroom. In addition to the Hanban grant, China stated that the Chinese Embassy in Armenia is willing to provide necessary assistance for the multimedia classroom.  Ambassador to Armenia Tian Erlong, Armenian Deputy Foreign Minister Manassarian, Ms. Gasparyan, President of Brüssov University, Dean of Confucius Institute Central Asia and representatives of teachers and students of the school attended the ceremony.
justification: Project focuses on education and cultural exchange without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of education materials, establishment of Chinese translation multimedia classroom, cultural/educational focus

title: Traditional Chinese physicians provide medical consultation to Thailand and Malaysia
description: In February 2015, a team of traditional Chinese physicians performed free medical consultations for over 630 patients in Thailand and Malaysia. The team consisted of physicians from the First Affiliated Hospital of Guangxi Medical University, Guangxi Autonomous Region People's Hospital, and the First Affiliated Hospital of Guangxi University of Traditional Chinese Medicine. A total of 6 free consultation activities and 1 special lecture on Traditional Chinese Medicine health knowledge were carried out,  The doctors were organized by the Overseas Chinese Affairs Office and the Overseas Chinese Affairs Office in Guangxi Province.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Traditional Chinese physicians provide medical consultation to Thailand and Malaysia

# Description
In February 2015, a team of traditional Chinese physicians performed free medical consultations for over 630 patients in Thailand and Malaysia. The team consisted of physicians from the First Affiliated Hospital of Guangxi Medical University, Guangxi Autonomous Region People's Hospital, and the First Affiliated Hospital of Guangxi University of Traditional Chinese Medicine. A total of 6 free consultation activities and 1 special lecture on Traditional Chinese Medicine health knowledge were carried out,  The doctors were organized by the Overseas Chinese Affairs Office and the Overseas Chinese Affairs Office in Guangxi Province.
justification: Project focuses on healthcare services without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Traditional Chinese physicians providing medical consultations, health knowledge lecture

title: PRC Poverty Reduction and Regional Cooperation Fund grants $4.025 million USD for 2015 Projects
description: On 24 March 2005, the Chinese Government and Asian Development Bank (ADB) jointly established the People's Republic of China (PRC) Poverty Reduction and Regional Cooperation Fund. The China Ministry of Finance provided financing and ADB implemented the projects. The purpose of this special fund is to support the process of poverty reduction, regional cooperation and knowledge sharing for ADB developing member countries (DMCs) in the Asia-Pacific as well as Greater Mekong Subregion (GMS) and Central Asia Regional Economic Cooperation (CAREC) countries.  According to a 2019 Annual Report (p. 35), on 23 July 2015, the Chinese Ministry of Finance approved $1.225 million USD from this special fund for three different Batch 1 projects:  1) $500,000 USD for "Strategy for Northeast Asia Power System Interconnection." Expected to close on 15 August 2019.  2) $500,000 USD for "Supporting the Asian Exim Banks Forum." Expected to close on 4 October 2020.  3) $225,000 USD for "Provision of Knowledge Products and Services to Developing Member Countries through Systematic Knowledge Sharing (supplementary)." Closed 1 February 2019.   According to a 2019 Annual Report (p. 35), on 6 January 2016, the Chinese Ministry of Finance approved $1.3 million USD from this special fund for six different Batch 2 projects:  1) $500,000 USD for "Universal Health Coverage for Inclusive Growth: Supporting the Implementation of the Operational Plan for Health 2015–2020 (supplementary)." Expected to close on 31 December 2020.  2) $200,000 USD for "Capturing the Opportunities and Addressing the Risks (supplementary)." Expected to close 31 December 2019.  3) $500,000 USD for "Promoting Regional Knowledge Sharing Partnerships (supplementary)." Closed on 31 December 2018. 4) $500,000 USD for "Regional Evaluation Capacity Development II." Expected to close on 31 December 2019.  5) $500,000 USD for "Connecting the Railways of the Greater Mekong Subregion." Closed on 12 December 2018.  6) $600,000 USD for "Support for Project Implementation of the Nepal Earthquake Rehabilitation and Reconstruction Program (supplementary)." Expected to close on 31 December 2019.
staff_comments: Also called the PRC Fund or 中华人民共和国减贫与区域合作基金.Not marked as umbrella and did not separate batches 1 and 2 because the risk of duplication is very low.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER MULTISECTOR

# Title
PRC Poverty Reduction and Regional Cooperation Fund grants $4.025 million USD for 2015 Projects

# Description
On 24 March 2005, the Chinese Government and Asian Development Bank (ADB) jointly established the People's Republic of China (PRC) Poverty Reduction and Regional Cooperation Fund. The China Ministry of Finance provided financing and ADB implemented the projects. The purpose of this special fund is to support the process of poverty reduction, regional cooperation and knowledge sharing for ADB developing member countries (DMCs) in the Asia-Pacific as well as Greater Mekong Subregion (GMS) and Central Asia Regional Economic Cooperation (CAREC) countries.  According to a 2019 Annual Report (p. 35), on 23 July 2015, the Chinese Ministry of Finance approved $1.225 million USD from this special fund for three different Batch 1 projects:  1) $500,000 USD for "Strategy for Northeast Asia Power System Interconnection." Expected to close on 15 August 2019.  2) $500,000 USD for "Supporting the Asian Exim Banks Forum." Expected to close on 4 October 2020.  3) $225,000 USD for "Provision of Knowledge Products and Services to Developing Member Countries through Systematic Knowledge Sharing (supplementary)." Closed 1 February 2019.   According to a 2019 Annual Report (p. 35), on 6 January 2016, the Chinese Ministry of Finance approved $1.3 million USD from this special fund for six different Batch 2 projects:  1) $500,000 USD for "Universal Health Coverage for Inclusive Growth: Supporting the Implementation of the Operational Plan for Health 2015–2020 (supplementary)." Expected to close on 31 December 2020.  2) $200,000 USD for "Capturing the Opportunities and Addressing the Risks (supplementary)." Expected to close 31 December 2019.  3) $500,000 USD for "Promoting Regional Knowledge Sharing Partnerships (supplementary)." Closed on 31 December 2018. 4) $500,000 USD for "Regional Evaluation Capacity Development II." Expected to close on 31 December 2019.  5) $500,000 USD for "Connecting the Railways of the Greater Mekong Subregion." Closed on 12 December 2018.  6) $600,000 USD for "Support for Project Implementation of the Nepal Earthquake Rehabilitation and Reconstruction Program (supplementary)." Expected to close on 31 December 2019.
justification: Primary purpose is poverty reduction and regional cooperation through knowledge sharing and capacity building, with no direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Focus on poverty reduction, regional cooperation, knowledge sharing, and capacity building across multiple sectors including health, education, and infrastructure
